snippet: Proposition 10, the ballot measure to raise California cigarette taxes by 50 cents per pack to help finance health care and education services for children, was approved on Monday after late ballots from the Nov. 3 election were counted.    The me...
lead_paragraph: Proposition 10, the ballot measure to raise California cigarette taxes by 50 cents per pack to help finance health care and education services for children, was approved on Monday after late ballots from the Nov. 3 election were counted. The measure was approved by a margin of 57,070 votes from more than 7.6 million ballots counted. About one-third of the estimated 850,000 late absentee and provisional ballots remained uncounted, but the initiative's lead has grown steadily since the election.
abstract: Late ballots in California show that voters have approved Proposition 10, which would raise cigarette taxes to help finance health care and education services for children (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Increase in Cigarette Tax Is Approved in California
